task_summary: Detect the milk box (white carton) and push it to the right along the tabletop, then retreat to a safe position.

task_long_description.overview: A fixed-base robotic arm must push a milk box (white rectangular carton) on a tabletop. The scene includes multiple distractor objects: cans, a green bottle, a red prism, and a small pastry on the left. The robot first perceives the milk box, approaches and aligns its end effector, sets a neutral yaw, executes a straight push along the table, then retreats and pauses briefly. No grasp is required; motion should avoid toppling nearby objects or pushing the carton off the table.
preconditions: End effector suitable for planar pushing
Milk box present and visible on the right side of the table
stepwise_plan: Approach and align to establish a straight push path.
Set tool yaw to neutral for planar contact.
Push the milk box along the table to the right.
Retreat from contact and wait briefly.
success_criteria: Milk box translates on the tabletop by the commanded distance without tipping.
Robot ends in a safe, non-contact pose.
failure_and_recovery: If the milk box is not detected, re-scan or adjust viewpoint.
If alignment drifts, re-run ApproachAndAlign before pushing.
If push stalls due to friction or obstruction, reduce contact point or repeat with a slightly longer distance.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after the push completes, the robot retreats, and a short wait elapses.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Perceive and localize the milk box target.
Approach the carton and align EE for planar push within tight tolerance.
Set end-effector yaw to neutral for straight push.
Execute straight-line push to the right by 0.20 m.
Back off from the object after pushing.
Short pause to ensure stability after motion.

failure_modes: Target not detected due to occlusion or glare
End effector misaligned causing diagonal motion or tipping
Carton pushed off the table edge
recovery_strategy: Re-run perception or scan from a slightly different viewpoint
Shorter push distance in multiple cycles
assumptions: “milk box” refers to the white rectangular carton visible on the right; mapped to symbolic target "milk_box".
Push direction is camera-right (direction_deg=0) inferred from frames where the arm moves the carton rightward.
